## Climatology

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="60%"}

Uniquely situated in a 

* Summer heatwaves and droughts
  * Decreased C uptake and increased C emission
  * Increase wildfire risk
    * Fires in the bog release C
    * Smoke events reduce C uptake 
* Intense winter precipitation

:::

::: {.column width="40%"}

```{python}
#| fig-cap: "BBECA Climatology"
#| fig-alt: "Climate Data from the BBECA Envrionment Canada Weather Station (2010 - 2022)"
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

ECC = pd.read_csv('BB_Data/DELTA BURNS BOG.csv',parse_dates=['LOCAL_DATE'],low_memory=False)
ECC = ECC.set_index('LOCAL_DATE')
ECC_m = ECC[['TEMP']].groupby(ECC.index.month).mean()
ECC_ym = ECC[['PRECIP_AMOUNT']].resample('m').sum()
ECC_m['PRECIP_AMOUNT'] = ECC_ym.groupby(ECC_ym.index.month).mean()

kwargs = {'color':'red','edgecolor':'k'}

fig,ax=plt.subplots(2,sharex=True)
ax[0].bar(ECC_m.index,ECC_m['TEMP'],**kwargs)
ax[0].grid()
ax[0].set_ylabel('$\circ C$')
ax[0].set_title('Mean Monthly Air Temperature')

kwargs['color']='blue'
ax[1].bar(ECC_m.index,ECC_m['PRECIP_AMOUNT'],**kwargs)
ax[1].grid()
ax[1].set_xticklabels(['','Feb','Apr','Jun','Aug','Oct','Dec'])
ax[1].set_ylabel('mm')
ax[1].set_title('Mean Monthly Precipitation')

print()

```
